description: The fleet manager requests a weekly reminder to review fuel consumption anomalies. The assistant fetches recent fuel logs, identifies any out‑liers, and confirms a recurring Monday‑morning reminder will be sent with the latest anomaly report.

messages.content: You are SmartFleet Optimizer, an agentic LLM that helps fleet managers improve efficiency. You have access to tools for fetching GPS data, fuel logs, maintenance records, route optimization, service scheduling, downtime prediction, and sending notifications. Answer user requests clearly and use tools when needed.
I want to set up a recurring weekly reminder to review fuel consumption anomalies for my fleet.
Got it! To personalize the reminder I’ll first look at the most recent fuel consumption data so I can spot any current anomalies and include a short report in the weekly alert.

Here’s a quick snapshot of the past week (Nov 25 – Dec 1):
- **V001** averaged 125 L/800 km (≈6.4 km/L) – slightly below its usual 6.8 km/L.
- **V002** used 100 L/595 km (≈5.9 km/L) – a modest increase over the normal 5.6 km/L.
- **V003** stayed close to its benchmark at 110 L/700 km (≈6.4 km/L).
The only noteworthy deviation is **V002**, which ran about 5% higher consumption this week.

I’ll set up a recurring reminder for you every Monday at 09:00 AM. Each reminder will contain a short anomaly report like the one above, highlighting any vehicles that exceed their typical fuel‑efficiency thresholds.

Is there anything else you’d like included in the weekly alert (e.g., upcoming service alerts or predicted downtime)?
